content: Yes, just had a look at your hackmd doc about checking your own attestations <@212146572736200704> . Nice, and could be used for detection of any, but 6-7 MB per validator will probably be too much in mainnet. Hence the interest in an optimized attestation DB index

author: pscott1337
content: Right now we are considering pruning the db, and keeping only something the last X epochs, as mentioned in the hackmd under ‚ÄúPruning by epochs‚Äù

author: protolambda
content: Yes, but last time the ambitions for long term detection were pretty high, like 8 months worth, so with a high validator count that still blows up to near terabyte range. I believe it can be ~2-3 GB for 8 months mainnet if done well

author: pscott1337
content: Say we keep the last 512 slots, we would have a db that would be at most 88 * 512 ~= 45kB

author: pscott1337
content: Oh yeah indeed, if the goal is to detect  if other validators missbehaved, then my approach is definitely not desirable!

content: Right, the problem is super similar, but the count and use (risk of missing something / slower speed) is very different
